 If you ever get the chanc to visit italy, wander through some of the grave yards. Besides having the tombs of some interesting historical figures, you will note that many graves have a caption on the top that reads "fallen hero". These were all soldiers that dies during WWII. Mussolini had it put on every grave. They also printed a "fallen hero" section in the weekly newspaper with (largely fictional) accounts of the exploits of recently deceased italian soldiers. 
 
 Supremacy of the military, not only budgetary, but also excessive glamorization of soldiers and military service, is one of the defining traits of a fascist society.

Bush's comment just avoids the question, which doesn't interest or surprise me. He has yet to impress me with any words that come out of his mouth.
 
 What REASON is behind the concsciouss decision NOT to label it as government produced, when it's considered NOT ethical to leave such a label off? No one calls him on his comments.
 
 But then thinking either Bush, or the media, has any interest in:
 The truth
 The public's best interest
 
 Would be poor reasoning on our part.
 
 Likewise thinking the PUBLIC knows what's in the public's best interest, or cares about the truth, is another silly conclusion.
 
 -Mach
